verbs.description: revegetate (third-person singular simple present revegetates, present participle revegetating, simple past and past participle revegetated)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, intransitive) To grow again (of a plant, leaf etc.). [17th–19th c.]
examples: Forsyth's Power real or imaginary of healing wounded Plants, and making them revegetate is a strange Thing:—more strange than true I fancy  […] .

entries.meaning: (transitive, chiefly ecology) To produce new vegetation on (a barren ground or area); to colonize (barren ground). [from 19th c.]
(intransitive, of barren ground) To become recolonized by plants. [from 20th c.]
